p: A total of eight compounds were separated from the 70% methanol extract of M. volcanica and identified via NMR, EI-MS, and LC-MS analysis as well as by comparison with a previously published paper and a standard compound (rutin). These compounds are shikimic acid ( 2) [ 29], gallic acid ( 3) [ 30], protocatechuic acid ( 4) [ 31], 4,4′-dihydroxy-3,3′-imino-di-benzoic acid ( 6) [ 32], miquelianin ( 7) [ 33], rutin ( 8) [ 34], quercitrin ( 9) [ 35], and quercetin ( 10) [ 36], as shown in Table S2 and Figure 6. Moreover, the raw NMR spectra are shown in Figures S2–S9. Notably, we report the structural information of these eight compounds from M. volcanica for the first time, which is supposed to provide essential phytochemical evidence and promote the research and application of this plant [ 16].
